H0.text: how long do former presidents get secret service protection. 10 years

H1.text: how long do former presidents get secret service protection. 5 years

H2.text: how long do former presidents get secret service protection. Until the age of 70

H3.text: how long do former presidents get secret service protection. lifetime

A4.text: In 1994, this was amended to reduce the protection period to 10 years after a former president left office, starting with presidents assuming the role after January 1, 1997.

A5.text: On January 10, 2013, President Barack Obama signed legislation reversing this limit and reinstating lifetime protection to all former presidents.

A6.text: Prior to 1997, all former presidents, their spouses, and their children until age 16 were protected by the Secret Service until the president's death.
